snippet: Victor Willis, formerly of the Village People, won a suit to reclaim control of his music in 2013 after the 35-year copyright ends. The ruling has the potential to change the music business.
abstract: Victor Willis, formerly of the Village People, won a suit to reclaim control of his music in 2013 after the 35-year copyright ends. The ruling has the potential to change the music business.

headline.main: Village People Singer Wins a Legal Battle in Fight to Reclaim Song Rights
headline.print_headline: Lyricist of ‘YMCA’ Wins Suit Over Control of Songs
